<JD_START>
Job Title: Payroll Account Analyst

Location: Quebec, NC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Share this job

General Information

Payroll Accounting Analyst includes analysis and maintenance of accounting information, reconciliation of discrepancies and consolidation of accounting data and reports as they relate to payroll.

Investigate, analyze, and prepare complex financial and business information in support of payroll activities. Compile information and prepare reports. Analyze trends affecting various financial activities. Recommend and implement measures to improve operations and services to customers. Partner with Payroll, Finance, and shared services to support business needs. Ideal candidate would have experience with both US and Canadian payroll accounting practices. Future scope of the role may require support of and/or providing direction to support Canadian payroll accounting activities.

Responsibilities

Review/reconcile general ledger accounts to ensure accurate reporting for payroll.Submit journal entries.Submit accruals for benefits not calculated in the payroll module.Analyze, reclass, and true up by a journal entry of vacation.Create new purchase orders for Payroll and Benefits each year.Work independently to answer questions from other finance professionals.Investigating and resolving audit findings, account discrepancies, and issues of non-compliance.Work with finance to design, establish, modify, verify and implement cost-effective programs to meet financial requirements.Assist with reconciling tax and processing payroll when necessary.Living Hitachi Energy’s core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in finance/accounting or a related field or a combination of experience and/or demonstrated accomplishments.Candidate must already have work authorization that would permit them to work for Hitachi Energy in the United States.3-5 years of accounting/payroll experienceStrong communication skillsAbility to deal with sensitive and confidential information.Ability to establish priorities, work independently, and proceed with objectives with little supervision.Prior payroll experience in Canada and the US is a plus.

Only selected applicants will be contacted. 

Apply now

Location Saint-Laurent, Quebec, Canada

Raleigh, North Carolina, United States of America Job type Full time Experience Experienced Job function Human Resources Contract Regular Publication date 2024-04-18 Reference number R0040217

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
